translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Pairs of Doctrinal Ideas

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Dukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (2)🔽14.8. Sanidassanaduka🔽Anidassanaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassano dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaṁ
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya  sani das sana duka  anidassanam dhammam paṭicca na anidassanaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana
translated: The Doctrinal Ideas with Visible-Range🔽With visible-range as condition, non-visible-range idea arises, by way of root-cause condition. With non-visible-range

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassano dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na sanidassanaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassanam dhammam paṭicca
translated: as condition, non-visible-range idea arises, by way of root-cause condition. With non-visible-range

original: nasanidassano ca naanidassano ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na anidassano ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: as condition, non-visible-range and visible-range ideas arise, by way of root-cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe avigate tīṇi sabbattha vitthāro
translated: In the root-cause, there are three; in the object, there is one; … in the dissociation, there are three. (Everywhere in detail.)
